item.title: Airstrike in Gaza destroys building with AP bureau...
item.description:
apnews.com

item.title: VIACOMCBS says ex-CEO Moonves won't get $120M severance...
item.description:
apnews.com
NEW YORK (AP) — ViacomCBS said Friday that former CBS CEO Les Moonves will not get his $120 million severance package from his firing in 2018, ending a long-running dispute over the money. Moonves was ousted in 2018 after a company investigation into allegations of sexual misconduct spanning three decades found Moonves violated company policy and did not cooperate with the investigation.

item.description:
apnews.com
